snippet: On Tuesday, the Treasury Department banned the Lebanese militant organization from any dealings with Americans, citing its “alarming reach” and intervention in the Syrian civil war.
abstract: United States blacklists four fund-raising operatives for Lebanese militant organization Hezbollah and warns of further steps to choke group's financing as part of ongoing retribution effort against operatives for helping Syrian government fight rebels.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: On Tuesday, the Treasury Department banned the Lebanese militant organization from any dealings with Americans, citing its “alarming reach” and intervention in the Syrian civil war.

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
